channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: DILG urged to allow LGUs to fund for hazard pay for garbage collectors
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The organization earlier appealed to the government to grant garbage collectors hazard pay “due to the risk they face in the performance of essential waste management services, which can be considered hazardous, especially under the extraordinary circumstance brought about by the coronavirus outbreak.”

item.title: LIVE updates: COVID-19 and extended quarantine in the Philippines
item.author: PhilstarLIVE
item.description: The latest updates on the spread of the novel coronavirus in the Philippines and enhanced community quarantine of economic center of Metro Manila and other areas across the country.

item.title: Government affirms support for ‘Balik-Probinsya’ program
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Government agencies have started to draw up measures in support of Sen. Bong Go’s proposed “Balik-Probinsya” program that aims to redistribute people and growth to the countryside and ease congestion in Metro Manila.

item.title: DOH records 2nd highest COVID recoveries
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: The Department of Health yesterday reported 70 new recoveries from the coronavirus disease 2019, the second highest ever number in a span of 24 hours.

item.title: DOT launches ‘Wake Up in PH’ video
item.author: Catherine Talavera
item.description: The Department of Tourism has released the “Wake Up In PH” promotional video targeted at retaining interest in the Philippines in the foreign market.

item.title: POGOs, gambling still banned in GCQ areas
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Philippine offshore gaming operators and other forms of gambling are not yet allowed even in areas under general community quarantine, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: DFA protests additional 14-day quarantine for seafarers
item.author: Rudy Santos
item.description: Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. has protested the imposition of another 14-day quarantine for Filipino seafarers who have already finished quarantine for the coronavirus disease during their long sea voyage to Manila.

item.title: LGUs can’t modify quarantine levels
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: Only the national government will have the authority to modify community quarantine levels in cities, municipalities, provinces and regions in the country.

item.title: Taiwan open to Pinoy workers
item.author: Rudy Santos
item.description: The recruitment association deploying Filipino workers to Taiwan has welcomed the news that Taiwan is open to accept more workers from the Philippines by May.

item.title: 230,000 OFWs displaced by pandemic
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: The coronavirus disease pandemic has displaced over 230,000 overseas Filipino workers so far, and the OFWs are seeking financial aid from the government.
